page.title: 17WARMINGTON SCHOOL
page.content: The School occupies a site in the middle of the village. It was built in 1873 and remodelled in 1970 with three classrooms, a central area, hall, kitchen and cloakrooms and store rooms. In 1979 the school was a County Primary School with a roll of 81 but this rapidly fell when the Oundle Middle School opened. It is now 32 organised into an Infant Room and a Junior Room. The curriculum comprises Language, Mathematics, Environmental Studies, Science and Technology, Art, Craft and Design, Music, Physical Education and Religious Education. At present the staff consists of one full time Infant Teacher, the Head Teacher who takes the Junior group and a part time teacher who shares the Junior work with the Head. The non-teaching staff, all part time, secretary, a cook, a dinner supervisor and a cleaner/janitor.
